title: What is a .so file in Android? - Quora

response.answer_text: SO file is know as Shared Library file. When you write code in C or C++, you compile all the C++ code into the .SO file. The .SO file is the shared object library which can be dynamically loaded at the runtime of Android. Library files are bigger in size, typically in the range of 2MB to 10MB. This results in bloating up the app size. Another point to note is that in order to support multiple architectures like armeabi and x86, multiple .SO files should be bundled in the APK. Learn more here: Reduce the size of your app by moving .SO files to over-the-air

SO is an abbreviation of Shared Library file, which contains information that can be used by more than 1 program to offload resources. As a result, .so file doesn’t have to provide actual SO file. They can even be updated or replaced without those programs that have to make changes to their own code. .so file is similar to DDL (Dynamic Link Library) file used in Windows. If you want to open it, you can use GNU Compiler Collection. But it’s just stored in specific folder and will automatically used by programs, so maybe you cannot understand the content you see.
